results.title: Brave Kate

Displaying trmendous courage and resourcefulness she tracks the murderes and eliminates them one by one. Animated by Vlasta Pospisilova, Xenie Maresova and Alfons Mensdorff-Pouilly.

results.title: Brave Irene
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, Paul R. Gagne and Daniel Ivanick
results.brief_description: Irene’s mother is a seamstress who has been chosen to make a dress for the Duchess to wear to the big ball. When her mother gets sick, Irene decides to take the dress to the duchess herself. On the way there it begins to snow, but Irene is determined to reach the palace before the ball. Narrated by Lindsay Crouse. Based on the book by William Steig.

results.title: Brassed off
results.creator_credit: Channel Four Films, Miramax Films, Steve Abbot and Mark Herman
results.brief_description: The Grimethorpe Colliery Band doesn’t have much to play for these days with the shadow of the mine’s imminent closure looming over them. Danny (Pete Postlethwaite) doesn’t share this view, as band master he sees the band as the life blood of the community. His son has the opposite view, blaming the conservative Thatcher government for the community’s misfortune. The band receives a lift in spirits with the arrival of Gloria (Tara Fitzgerald), a fluglehorn player eager to join the band but unbeknown to them is also part of the “management” team making decisions about the mine. For Andy (Ewan McGregor), Gloria’s appearance sparks memories of their brief teenage romance. When the mine closes and Danny is placed into hospital, plans for competing in the National Championship are placed on hold. After a series of conflicts however the band discovers a way of venting their anger and telling their story as well as that of miners elsewhere. An enjoyable comedy with a serious message about economic policy and the mining community. Also starring Jim Carter, Phillip Jackson, Stephen Moore, Ken Colley and Peter Gunn.

results.title: Brass
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Harry Rapf and Sidney A. Franklin
results.brief_description: Philip Baldwin (Monte Blue) is the son of a prosperous fruit-farmer. His marriage to Rosemary, daughter of his father’s best friend has been planned since they were children, but when gold-digging city girl Marjorie (Marie Prevost) finds work during the summer vacation at the ranch, she seduces Philip into marriage. Domestic problems, city living and friction with his mother-in-law contribute to Marjorie divorcing Philip and abandoning their son. Philip then discovers true love with Mrs Grotenberg (Irene Rich) the widow who boards with the family and cares for the child. Cast also includes Harry Meyers, Frank Keenan and Harvey Clark. Based on the novel by Charles G. Norris.

results.title: Branding
results.brief_description: If you must brand, brand as lightly and as small as possible - this Wool Board film shows the woolgrower the financial loss caused, and the damage done to Australian-grown wool by the practice of branding sheep, stressing that the extra costs involved in removing brands before the wool is manufactured into cloth are inevitably passed back to growers and to the public. Narrated by Keith Eden.

results.title: Branded to kill [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Nikkatsu Kabushiki Kaisha, Kaneo Iwai and Seijun Suzuki
results.brief_description: Hanado Goro, no. 3 gunman in the Tokyo underworld after killing no. 2 and bungling the fourth of a series of imaginatively executed ‘hits’, finds himself playing cat-and-mouse with the dangerous no. 1. Explosions of violence are punctuated by moments of unexpected lyricism and intermingled with bizarre humour (Hanado is sexually aroused by the smell of boiled rice). After making dozens of run-of-the-mill genre films for Nikkatsu, Sejun Suzuki began transforming the banal material assigned to him into farcically hyperbolic absurdist thrillers reinventing the yakuza film by drawing on Japanese comical literary, theatrical and cinematic traditions (see also “Tokyo drifter”), in the process attracting both a cult following and the ire of Nikkatsu. Cast includes Jo Shishido, Koji Nanbara, Isao Tamagawa, Annu Mari, Mariko Ogawa and Hiroshi Minami. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Branded Si-Ro-Mark
results.creator_credit: Australian Wool Board and Frank Land
results.brief_description: Each year, great damage is done to the Australian wool clip by branding fluids. At wool sales, the price for marked wool decreases and in scouring and milling processes later, it is impossible to remove all the dirty wool, resulting in the needless waste of finished woollen goods. The CSIRO has developed an accurable and permanent branding fluid, “Si-Ro-Mark” and its wide-spread use to replace tar, sump-oil and other unsatisfactory fluids is advocated, not only in the interests of the grower but also the Australian wool and woollen textile industry as a whole.

results.title: Branchline railway
results.brief_description: Michael Palin, confessed train buff, introduces unique footage from the BBC archive: Branchline Railway and two historic newsreel sequences - a splendid requiem for the steam railway. “Branchline Railway”: the late Sir John Betjeman presents this little known film which perfectly captures the atmosphere of a 24 mile stretch of the now vanished Somerset and Dorset railway. It celebrates a working, living railway, complete with dirty locomotives, clean stations decked with flowers, and austere gas-lit waiting rooms. It all belongs to a vanished age but the film remains to delight and inform (broadcast 1963). “Britannia under her own steam” looks at the naming of the first magnificent Class 7 4-6-2 Standard locomotives ‘Britannia’ (broadcast 1951). “Atlantic Coast Express” is a footplate journey on Merchant Navy Class No. 35016 ‘Elder Fyffe’ as it heads the ‘Atlantic Coast Express’ (broadcast 1960).
